label: Letter from Gertrude Sanford Legendre, February 17, 1943
description: Letter from Gertrude Legendre to her husband, Sidney Legendre, voicing her concerns that Sidney is losing himself and becoming more like his brother Morris. She goes on to discuss business at Medway Plantation and wishing one day she will be able to join him in Hawaii.

Feb 17th '43

The air mail must be improving because you received my letter of th e
_ sixth onfthe Ilth. I received your IIth on the I7th. I cant make out whether you

it wrong. You forgot to number your last one of the II th.
Your dinner at the Moody's sounds wonderful. You say "I wonder how
much people do become alike when they are together.We are told over and over again
how alike we are etc Perhaps it will improve me who knows". Please dont become
like anything but yourself.I like the way ou are- not how Morris is but_y2u  Sidney.
Morris' exagerations are alright for Morris,but Sweetheart stay just the way you
are and dont imitate him.One is so apt to be swamped by a stronger character, older ,
brother or what have you, but I remember when we get married and you broke away
from Morris you were much more of a person. Morris sort of domaneered the situat ion
and was the Boss before that time- do you sort of remember what I mean? You two'
are a heavenly pair, but yourself and dont follow along all the time. Maybe you
think I am cr azy to say such a thing but I dont mean anything at all against Morris
whom.I adore, not at all,so dont think I am chritlsizing hime I'm not. I
guess I just love you for the way you are and dont want anybody to change you.
That doodles at the party sounded lovely and I am surprised he_d1d '
n't make freinds with you at once. l thought dogs always could tell who loved

You forgot to give me your apartment address whnch I want very muc-h

Did you get my letter telling you how my India trip fell through?

Ellen is crazy to get me to take a week off and go to Florida with
